Package model.team

Class TeamManager

java.lang.Object
model.Manager
model.team.TeamManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
PropertyChangeObservable
public class TeamManager
extends Manager
TeamManager is responsible for executing all the commands needed for the application that are related to teams.

Remark that it is implemented with the singleton pattern, so only one instance of it exists.

Author:
Bori Fazakas, Beata Keresztes

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addMemberToTeam​(int teamId, java.lang.String userName)
    Adds the user with userName to the team with teamId if they both exist and the current user is the manager of the team.
    void createNewTeam​(java.lang.String name)
    Creates a new team with the given name, and with the manager being the currently logged in user.
    void deleteTeam​(int teamId)
    Deletes the team with the specified id from the database, but only if the current user is its manager.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static TeamManager getInstance()

    • createNewTeam

      public void createNewTeam​(java.lang.String name) throws java.sql.SQLException, NoSignedInUserException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException
      Creates a new team with the given name, and with the manager being the currently logged in user.
      Parameters:
      name - is the name of the new team.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      NoSignedInUserException - if the user is not signed in.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - - should never occur.

    • deleteTeam

      public void deleteTeam​(int teamId) throws java.sql.SQLException, InexistentTeamException, UnauthorisedOperationException, NoSignedInUserException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, InexistentUserException
      Deletes the team with the specified id from the database, but only if the current user is its manager. To do so, first, all the memberships and projects of the team are deleted.
      Parameters:
      teamId - is the id of the team to delete.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      InexistentTeamException - if no team with teamId exists in the database.
      UnauthorisedOperationException - if the current user is not allowed to delete the team, because the user is not the manager of the team.
      NoSignedInUserException - if the user is not signed in.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - - should never occur.
      InexistentUserException - should never occur.

    • getTeamsOfCurrentUser

      public java.util.List<Team> getTeamsOfCurrentUser() throws java.sql.SQLException, NoSignedInUserException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException
      Returns the teams in which the currently logged in user is a member.
      Returns:
      the list of teams having the current user as member.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      NoSignedInUserException - if the user is not signed in.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - - should never occur.

    • regenerateTeamCode

      public java.lang.String regenerateTeamCode​(int teamId) throws java.sql.SQLException, InexistentTeamException, NoSignedInUserException, UnauthorisedOperationException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException
      Generated a new, unique code for the team with the given id, and saves it. Remark that if no team with the given id exists, nothing happens, no exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      teamId - is the id of the team for which the new code is generated.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      InexistentTeamException - if no team with teamId exists in the database.
      UnauthorisedOperationException - if the current user is not allowed to delete the team, because the user is not the manager of the team.
      NoSignedInUserException - if the user is not signed in.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - - should never occur.

    • joinTeam

      public void joinTeam​(java.lang.String code) throws java.sql.SQLException, InexistentTeamException, NoSignedInUserException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, AlreadyMemberException
      Adds the current user as a member to the team with the given code, if it exists. Requirement: The user should not alrady be a member of the team.
      Parameters:
      code - is the code provided by the user of the team to join.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      InexistentTeamException - if no team with this code exists.
      NoSignedInUserException - if the user is not signed in.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - - should never occur.
      AlreadyMemberException - if the current user is already a member of the team.

    • leaveTeam

      public void leaveTeam​(int teamId) throws java.sql.SQLException, NoSignedInUserException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, InexistentTeamException, ManagerRemovalException, UnregisteredMemberRemovalException
      Removes the current user from the team with the given id. Requirement: the current user would be the member of the team, but not the manager.
      Parameters:
      teamId - is the id of the team to join.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      NoSignedInUserException - if the user is not signed in.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - - should never occur.
      InexistentTeamException - if the team to leave does not exist in the database.
      ManagerRemovalException - if the user who wants to leave is the manager.
      UnregisteredMemberRemovalException - if the user is not the member of the team.

    • addMemberToTeam

      public void addMemberToTeam​(int teamId, java.lang.String userName) throws java.sql.SQLException, InexistentTeamException, UnauthorisedOperationException, NoSignedInUserException, InexistentUserException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, AlreadyMemberException
      Adds the user with userName to the team with teamId if they both exist and the current user is the manager of the team. The user to add should not already be a member.
      Parameters:
      teamId - is the id of the team with the new member.
      userName - is the name of the user to be added to the team.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      InexistentTeamException - if no team with this teamId exists.
      UnauthorisedOperationException - if the current user is no the manager of the team.
      NoSignedInUserException - if the user is not signed in.
      InexistentUserException - if the requested new member with userName does not exist.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - - should never occur.
      AlreadyMemberException - if the user with userName is already a member of the team.

    • removeTeamMember

      public void removeTeamMember​(int teamId, java.lang.String userName) throws java.sql.SQLException, InexistentTeamException, UnauthorisedOperationException, NoSignedInUserException, InexistentUserException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, UnregisteredMemberRemovalException, ManagerRemovalException
      Removes the user with userName from the team with teamId if they both exist and the current user is the manager of the team. Requirement: the user to remove should be the member of the team, but not the manager.
      Parameters:
      teamId - is the id of the team which looses a member.
      userName - is the name of the user to be removed from the team.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      InexistentTeamException - if no team with this teamId exists.
      UnauthorisedOperationException - if the current user is no the manager of the team.
      NoSignedInUserException - if the user is not signed in.
      InexistentUserException - if the requested new member with userName does not exist.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - - should never occur.
      UnregisteredMemberRemovalException - if the user is not the member of the team.
      ManagerRemovalException - if the member to remove is the manager of the team (i.e. the current user wants to leave the team).

    • passManagerPosition

      public void passManagerPosition​(int teamId, java.lang.String newManagerName) throws java.sql.SQLException, InexistentTeamException, UnauthorisedOperationException, NoSignedInUserException, InexistentUserException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException, UnregisteredMemberRoleException
      Sets the manager of the team with the given id to be the user with the given name, but only if the current user is at the moment the manager of the team.
      Parameters:
      teamId - is the id of the team for which the manager is changes.
      newManagerName - is the name of the new manager as specified by the current one.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      InexistentTeamException - if there is no team with id teamId.
      UnauthorisedOperationException - if the current user is not the manager of the team, so they are not authorised to change the manager.
      UnregisteredMemberRoleException - if the manager to be set is not the member of the team.
      NoSignedInUserException - if the user is not signed in.
      InexistentUserException - if the requested new member with userName does not exist.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException

    • setNewName

      public void setNewName​(int teamId, java.lang.String newTeamName) throws java.sql.SQLException, InexistentTeamException, UnauthorisedOperationException, NoSignedInUserException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException
      Sets a new name for the team with the given code, but only if the current user is the manager of the team.
      Parameters:
      teamId - is the id of the team whose name is changed.
      newTeamName - is the new name of the team to set.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.
      InexistentTeamException - if there is no team with id teamId.
      UnauthorisedOperationException - if the current user is not the manager of the team, so they are not authorised to change the name.
      NoSignedInUserException - if the user is not signed in.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException - - should never occur.

    • getTeam

      public Team getTeam​(int teamId) throws java.sql.SQLException, InexistentTeamException
      Return the team specified by the teamId, which is selected by the user from the Teams list.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if a database error occurred
      InexistentTeamException - if the team is was not found in the database

    • getMembersOfTeam

      public java.util.List<User> getMembersOfTeam​(int teamId) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Gets the members of the specified team.
      Parameters:
      teamId - specifies the team
      Returns:
      the list of members
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when a database error occurs
